item.title: A brief History of Times New Roman
item.description: Mathew Butterick’s Practical Typography 1 features a section dedicated to the History of Times New Roman 2. It is an interesting read. Why not? Fame has a dark side. When Times New Roman appears in a book, document, or advertisement, it connotes apathy. It says, “I submitted to the font of least resistance.” Times New Roman is not a font choice so much as the absence of a font choice, like the blackness of deep space is not a colour.
